p: Traditional Chinese medicine herbs have been used for thousands of years. In 2003, glycyrrhizin, a traditional Chinese medicine, was suggested to be promising for treating SARS [95] and was considered to be effective and valuable owing to its availability and low toxicity. Searching the active compounds from Chinese herbal medicine to prevent SARS-CoV-2 could be a potential strategy. Chen and Du used molecular docking to find natural compounds and proposed five candidates, including scutellarin, baicalin, hesperetin, nicotianamine and glycyrrhizin, that were potential compounds targeting the ACE2 receptor and exerting an antiviral effect to prevent SARS-CoV-2 infection [96].
